turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The People (1891).
turn.2: The People (1891) The People was an official organ of the Socialist Labor Party of America (SLP), a weekly newspaper established in New York City in 1891.
turn.4: The paper is best remembered as a vehicle for the ideas of Daniel DeLeon (1852–1914), the dominant ideological leader of the SLP from the 1890s until the time of his death.
turn.5: Was this newspaper published in other cities?
turn.6: The paper became a daily in 1900, reverting to weekly publication in 1914 for budgetary reasons. Publication of the paper was moved to Palo Alto, California during its later years, finally terminating publication in 2008.
turn.7: How many years was this newspaper in publication?
turn.8: Its 117 years of continuous publication make "The People" the longest running socialist newspaper in the history of American political radicalism.
turn.10: The Workingmen's Party of the United States was established in August 1876 and renamed itself as the Socialist Labor Party of America at its National Congress in Newark, New Jersey a year later.
turn.11: Who were the members of the SLP?
turn.12: The members of the organization were predominantly immigrants from Germany throughout its earliest years, although the SLP did maintain 7 English-speaking Sections by the end of 1877.
